data.title: University of North Carolina School of the Arts
data.meta_description: The University of North Carolina School of the Arts is a top-ranked creative and performing arts conservatory in Winston-Salem, N.C.

News & Stories

UNCSA students, faculty and alumni to participate in this year's International Black Theatre Festival

Faculty, students and alumni from the schools of Drama and Filmmaking are connected to this year's International Black Theatre Festival (IBTF). The festival, which is held biennially by the North Carolina Black Repertory Company in Winston-Salem, runs from July 29-Aug. 3 and features a variety of events.

Producing success: How Lauren Vilchik is shaping the film industry

Before becoming an award-winning film producer and production attorney, Lauren Vilchik practiced corporate law in her hometown of Los Angeles. She is now the assistant dean for graduate studies at the UNCSA School of Filmmaking and has become renowned for her work in the film industry.

UNCSA alumni nominated for Emmy Awards

Several alumni from UNCSA are nominated for Emmy Awards for their work on some of the most popular television and streaming shows of the year. This year's awards include shows that aired from June 2023 through May 2024.

Building the future of the arts

Empower emerging artists who will shape the future of creativity

UNCSA is building the future of the arts by educating the next generation of creative innovators. With extraordinary accomplishments propelling us, we are poised to reach new heights.

Give to UNCSA
